meanings.definition: A person who makes clever or witty remarks.
meanings.sent1: The quipster at the party had everyone laughing with their clever jokes.
meanings.sent2: My friend is known as the quipster of our group because of their witty comments.
meanings.sent3: The quipster in the office always has a funny response ready for any situation.
meanings.sent4: Her quick wit turned her into a quipster, always ready with a clever comeback.
meanings.sent5: The quipster's humor brightened up even the dullest of days.

meanings.definition: To make a clever or witty remark.
meanings.sent1: She loves to quipster during conversations, always adding a touch of humor.
meanings.sent2: When feeling nervous, he tends to quipster to lighten the mood.
meanings.sent3: The comedian would quipster throughout his entire stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to quipster effortlessly made her the life of the party.
meanings.sent5: He would quipster at the most unexpected moments, catching everyone off guard.
